2025 Pujiang Talents Program

2025 Pujiang Talents Program
2025年度 上海市白玉兰 人才计划 浦江项目

September 19, 2025

Sponsor:

Science and Technology Commission of Shanghai Municipality (STCSM)
Shanghai Municipal Human Resources and Social Security Bureau (SMHRSSB)

 

About:

The 2025 Shanghai Pujiang Talents Program is now open for application. This program is designed for Chinese scholars who have studied abroad or in Hong Kong, Macao & Taiwan and now returned to Shanghai to work (including those who joined other nationalities during the study). For more details, please refer to the official announcement in Chinese.

 

Project Type:

  • Type A Scientific Research and Development:
    Applicants should conduct in natural sciences and/or technology research.
    Project Term: from 12/01/2025 to 11/30/2027
    Funding Amount: RMB 300,000 per project
     
  • Type C Social Sciences
    Applicants should conduct in innovative research in the humanities and social sciences. 
    Project Term: from 12/01/2025 to 11/30/2028
    Funding Amount: RMB 150,000 per person

 

Eligibility:

  • The applicant should refer to the “Pujiang Talents Plan Operation Guideline” for the details of general eligibility.
  • Any research content that is already sponsored by other government funding cannot be used to apply for this plan.
  • Applicants are under the age of 45 (born on or after January 1, 1980). Once funded, the applicant should work full-time in China (no less than 9 months per year). The number of applicants for team projects should be no less than 3, and all members should meet the application requirements.
  • For the Type A, applicants should hold a PhD degree AND continuous study or training abroad for 2 years or more; For the Type C, applicants should hold a PhD degree or a master degree with a senior professional title or an intermediate professional title in art area AND continuous study or training abroad for 1 year or more.
  • The applicants who have returned to Shanghai to work and conduct innovative research enter the country after January 1, 2022. The applicants and teams who have not yet entered the country, but have reached a clear employment intention with the employer in this city, or have reached a landing intention with the relevant entrepreneurial parks, may also declare according to the relevant regulations. The entry and exit records shall prevail for continuous study or further study abroad, as well as the time of entering the country for work and starting a business.

 

Application:

  1. Applicants need to complete an online “Qualification Verification” before starting an application. The time window for conducting this verification is from 09/18/2025 to 09/30/2025. Detailed procedure can be found in the Attachment.
  2. All applications should be submitted online. Applicants can enter the application page through “上海国际人才网”—人才计划一站申报—“上海市白玉兰人才计划” 在线办理--浦江项目 or with the link to enter the login page directly. Online project submissions will open on September 19, 2025, and close on October 11, 2025.

There would be two rounds of review: peer review and on-site review.

 

Important Dates:

DATES (Shanghai Time)TO BE COMPLETED
By September 26, 2025Faculty who intend to apply should notify us at shanghai.researchgrants@nyu.edu.
By October 7, 2025Please send your application (including the grant proposal and supplemental documents) for institutional review.
By 4 PM October 10, 2025Finalize and submit your proposal via the online system.
Status
Open

New York University

Equal Opportunity and Non-Discrimination at NYU - New York University is committed to maintaining an environment that encourages and fosters respect for individual values and appropriate conduct among all persons. In all University spaces—physical and digital—programming, activities, and events are carried out in accordance with applicable law as well as University policy, which includes but is not limited to its Non-Discrimination and Anti-Harassment Policy.
